Description: High dimensional multiplexed immunofluorescence (HDmIF) via NeoGenomics MultiOmyx offers the capability to profile diverse tumor cell and microenvironmental features across spatial resolutions. We optimized a custom 26-marker fluorescently conjugated antibody panel interrogating HER2 expression, HER2 signaling, stromal, and immune markers via MultiOmyx and applied it to a tissue microarray encompassing 640 total cores from of 208 unique HER2+ tumors, totaling 1,076,700 single cells profiled. This allowed concurrent assessment of 1) HER2 heterogeneity at four spatial resolutions; 2) single cell-level phenotypic analyses of concurrent expression of six HER2 signaling proteins in tumor cells; 3) immunophenotype of 23 immune cell types.
SearchResultBody: ESP03B. Translating High Dimensional Multiplexed Immunofluorescence (HDmIF) Spatial Profiling of Novel HER2 Heterogeneity Metrics for Clinical Application
Title: Translating High Dimensional Multiplexed Immunofluorescence (HDmIF) Spatial Profiling of Novel HER2 Heterogeneity Metrics for Clinical Application
